column2: Snorkel, 55-64 Male  (Patient)
column9: I'm not rating the effectiveness or side effects of the drug here. The other reviews seem to cover that. But I want to advise everyone that there is a much cheaper way to get the same medications. When my doctor first prescribed Lotrel for me, I priced it at Walmart, and it was something like $72 for a month's supply. It may be more than that now. Folks, it is nothing more than a combination of amlodipine and benazepril. Get your doctor to prescribe the two drugs separately (mine had no problem with that). That way, the price drops to $4 each, or $8 per month total for EXACTLY THE SAME medication.

column2: migrainefreeinNY, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: This drug has been very effective in controlling my HBP.  I have experienced side effects in varying degrees, such as leg/ankle swelling, dry cough, weight gain and worst of all, fatigue and muscle weakness. HOWEVER, this drug has also made my severe and frequent migraines virtually nonexistent now (doctored for migraines for over 10 years). Because of the side effects, I recently tried a different drug to treat the HBP. New drug side effects seemed minimal, but within a few weeks, I started to get migraines again.  Sooo, back on the Lotrel, now with a second (water)pill for fluid retention symptom, and dealing with the rest.  Anything is better than having my life ruled by migraines, ever again!  Blood pressure continues to be well controlled.

column2: Littlegull, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: After taking 3 consecutive rounds of antibiotics once in 06 and then in 07, and taking Lotrel at the same time, I developed over two years of chronic fatigue, extreme energy drain every 2-3 hours for several months, fatigue and an irritated urinary track and frequency problem. My GI dr said antibiotics damaged digestive system in 06. When my new primary care dr double my Lotrel dosage to 10-20 I lost my ability to speak normally along with the extreme energy drain and fatigue (felt very ill) Asked several drs could a med be causing this problem. Was too quickly dismissed by them.  I read the med summary on rxlist.com about how you should not take an ace inhibitor if you don't have edema. I told my dr that I became very ill when she doubled the dosage of Lotrel. I stopped taking the ace inhibitor and after 15 months of not being able to speak normally my voice immediately returned to normal. The severe energy drain improved considerably. I am now taking just the calcium channel blocker that is in Lotrel(Norvas generic version). I have now developed ocular migraine episodes and eye pressure at the 10mg level with the calcium channel blocker. I have lost 17 lbs. doing Atkins hoping I can get off blood pressure meds altogether. I never realized how harmful antibiotics could be to your digestive system and how bad side effects could be using a blood pressure med. As a patient, it is wise to do your own research and  check out meds before you take them. My dr wants me to report to the FDA what happened to me using Lotrel.

column2: Dietmar, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have had high blood pressure for some time and it became increasingly difficult to treat. Lotrel (I am using the generic version) in combination with another drug did control the blood pressure. However, shortly after starting to take Lotrel, I began to develop virtually every side effect mentioned in the reviews:  Swelling of my knees, lower legs,and feet. The bottom of my feet feel like I am walking on ice bare footed, while the feet are warm. Extreme loss of appetite, difficulty sleeping.  Wake up to urinate but very little comes out.  Volume is normal during the day. Legs hurt from the knees down, especially at night. I have frequent chills. I am, at times, freezing at 80 degrees. I also had dry cough and "upper respiratory infection". I lost all my stamina and tire very easily. The whole situation was complicated when I had a Total Knee replacement in February, 2009. The wounds healed quickly, I had the stitches removed and walked with a cane in two weeks. The constant swelling delayed the internal healing and I have pain in the knee proportional to the swelling. My Orthopedic doctor was so concerned that he sent me to a GOOD family doctor who realized some of the causes, namely the Lotrel, right away and is following through with a complete investigation of all the symptoms.  This new doctor is good: Can you imagine a one (1) hour office visit??  The responses from other people are verifying what the doctor told me so far.

column2: cozaar, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I started taking this drug over a year ago. I had chronic hypertension the likes of which my Dr had never seen on anyone conscious.  She told me my age was saving me and put me on Lotrel. HBP runs in my family. Within two weeks my BP was down to normal ranges.  However a year and a half later I cannot bear the dry cough that wakes me up at night, annoys my pastor in church and keeps people at a distance from me at work because they are afraid they are going to catch something. I mean I cough till I get ligh headed and feel like I am going to pass out. Forget making me laugh....I will cough forever before I stop!  What is worse is I am fighting to take off the 20 lbs I have gained. I have drastically increased my workout routine. I took up boxing. I go to a traditional boxing gym 4 times a week and have been going since October. I have only lost 6 lbs despite of the fact that I have dropped ALL my bad habits including beer! No alcohol whatsoever since November.  No pizza, no fatty foods, low calories. I avoid processed food where I can. No binge eating. No explanation for the little improvement. I just have to switch. My sex drive is down the drain. It takes forever to achieve an orgasm even when pleasuring myself. Sometime I even quit! That is all I need to switch. It works very well but hopefully something else will do the job.  You only live once and I would also like some of the other pleasures of life along with good health. Good luck to you all.

column2: SBKat, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My Dr gave me to high of dose, 5/40 & kept me on Lisinopril/HCTZ 20/25, I'm a 110lb 45yo Fe.  On 2/4/07, after 12 days I had a severe hypotensive episode, & lost my BP for a while. I have experienced brain damage, especially in regards to speech & memory, as well as numerous chronic neurologocical & physiological problems.  Interesting enough, the majority are noted side effects of Lotrel. I kept saying I felt like the drug was still in me, & was told no way. After going to the website askapatient.com, & reading 250+ other people's generally very negative comments about this drug, & speaking to different pharmacists who have told me they believe that some people will never lose their side effects even after discontinuing it, I strongly urge people to post their comments on that site & other medical sites to see what help, hopefully exists, for these problems.
